summary: Based on the provided documents, G. Robert Blakey is not explicitly mentioned. However, the documents pertain to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which investigated the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents primarily consist of payroll records, personnel records, and administrative documents related to HSCA staff. These records include payroll authorizations, employment verification requests, final determination notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board, and certifications of non-relationship to members of Congress. The documents provide insight into the administrative and personnel aspects of the HSCA's operations during its investigation.
significance: While G. Robert Blakey is not directly mentioned in these documents, the documents relate to the operations of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), which played a significant role in investigating the JFK assassination. The documents provide insight into the staff and administrative functions of the HSCA during its investigation.
